Yantou's Three Statements Yantou's Three Statements
Bite and go, bite and stay, want to go but can't, want to stay but can't, sometimes always don't go,
sometimes always don't stay. The master said in the hall:
Generally speaking, in teaching the Dharma,
it flows out from the state of no desire, with three statements.
This is just theoretical discussion.
Bite and go, bite and stay.
Want to go but can't, want to stay but can't.
Sometimes always don't go,
sometimes always don't stay.
They do not know the direction.
A clear-eyed person has no fixed position, suddenly appearing.
If discussing the battle,
each one must have the skill of biting a pig or dog.
If you have not yet penetrated or understood,
you must still have seven or eight points of understanding before you can enter the activity.
If you have always had eyes like a myrobalan fruit,
don't recklessly display your stupidity.
You will mistakenly strike and break your waist.
Do not say I did not tell you. According to Yantou's three statements,
biting and letting go is one.
Wanting to leave but not being able to leave,
wanting to stay but not being able to stay,
is one.
Sometimes not leaving at all,
sometimes not staying at all, is one.
The old editions take biting and letting go as one,
and biting and staying as one,
wanting to leave but not being able to leave,
wanting to stay but not being able to stay as one,
and do not consider the phrase sometimes not leaving at all, sometimes not staying at all as a mistake.
Now that it has been corrected,
I will briefly cite the hall discourse as evidence.

A shout divides the five teachings. A shout divides the five teachings. Newly added by Chan Master Mian'an Cheng of Jingyin.

is not used as a shout.

End of Volume Six of the Eyes of Humans and Gods, Completed in the Great Yuan Dynasty, Revised and Reprinted in the Eyes of Humans and Gods in the Great Yuan Dynasty, Revised and Reprinted in the Eyes of Humans and Gods in the Great Yuan Dynasty, Postscript to the Revised and Reprinted Eyes of Humans and Gods in the Great Yuan Dynasty, Postscript to the Revised and Reprinted Eyes of Humans and Gods in the Great Yuan Dynasty, In the past, Chan Master Huizhao of Huishan in Yue Province,
During the Song Chunxi period,
Compiled the essentials of the five houses,
Called the Eyes of Humans and Gods.
It was circulated in the monasteries.
As it has been transmitted and copied for a long time,
There are bound to be mistakes like mistaking a crow for a horse or a pig for a boar.
The copies also differ from each other a lot.
Some say it's that, some say it's this.
There are gains and losses between them.
On a free day, I compared the similarities and differences.
The erroneous ones were corrected.
The incomplete ones were supplemented.
The false ones were eliminated.
I still worry that it is not good.
However, the original arrangement.
The five schools also lost the sequence of the teachers' succession.
Now it is corrected.
First, the Linji and Caodong are listed.
This is because these two schools.
Both come from Nanyue and Mazu's lineage.
Next, the Yunmen, Fayan, and Caodong are listed.
This is because these three schools.
All come from Qingyuan and Shitou.
Moreover, in recent times, someone.
Pretending to be Qiu Xuansuo.
Faked the stele of Chan Master Daowu of Tianwang Temple west of Jiangling City.
It records that Tianwang succeeded Mazu and connected Longtan, Deshan, and Xuefeng.
So the Yunmen and Fayan schools were moved.
Those who pass over Mazu's teachings are extremely laughable.
According to the new and old maps and records of Jingzhou,
there was no Tianwang Temple west of the city.
The false stele's false words about the causes and conditions of Tianwang,
are all the actual events of Chan Master Tanzao of White Horse Temple west of the city.
These actual events of Tanzao,
are fully described in the old maps and records of Jingzhou,
as well as the Jingde Records of Transmission of the Lamp.
They can be verified.ğŸ”½Moreover, it is recorded in the Transmission of the Lamp and the Biographies of Eminent Monks that Tianhuang was the successor of Shitou and the teacher of Longtan.
The stele of Deshan and the records of the disciples under Yunmen,
as well as the essentials of the five schools of the previous generation,
have dozens of places.
They are as clear as the sun and stars.
They can dispel the confusion of later generations in the world.
They can prove the errors in the compilation before and after.
Now, at the Great Ming Hermitage in Fuzhou, Jianyuan Road,
the woodblocks have been carved.
It is shared with Chan students.
Those who read this collection,
Turn over the revealed cloth.
Cut off the rambling vines.
Clearly open the mouth.
Not on the tongue.
If not yet so,
The sword has long departed.ğŸ”½In the fourth year of the Yanyou era, on the dingsi day, the monk Zhiyou of Tianfeng in Fuzhou, Jiangxi, respectfully wrote this postscript.
The Jingde Records of the Transmission of the Lamp only records that Emperor Tianhuang succeeded Shi Tou.
But it does not know that there were two Dao Wu at the same time.
One succeeded Ma Zu.
Resided at Tian Wang Temple west of the city of Jing Zhou.
One succeeded Shi Tou.
Resided at Tian Huang Temple east of the city of Jing Zhou.

Examining the Tang Dynasty stele written by Gui Deng for Nanyue, the record of Zong Qu written by Gui Feng in response to Prime Minister Pei, and the stele inscription written by Quan De Yu for Ma Zu's stupa.
All can be relied upon.
Later, what Da Guan Ying quoted from the two stele inscriptions written by Qiu Xuan Su and Fu Zai.
The record is even more detailed.
This is nothing to doubt.
But in Qiu's inscription.
Because Longtan was a successor of Tianhuang, not Tianwang.
This cannot be without doubt.
I have examined the records of Xuefeng's words.
Xuefeng addressed the king of Min,
claiming to have attained the Way of Deshan and Shitou.
Also, in the preface to the records of Guishan, the national teacher,
it is also said that Guishan is the fifth-generation grandson of Shitou.
These two books were written during the Five Dynasties period.
Not far from Longtan.
How could they have suddenly forgotten their origins?
Based on this, it is known.
What Longtan was a successor to.
Was Tianhuang, not Tianwang.
This is the first piece of evidence.
Also, Longtan.
Lived in the Tianhuang Lane east of the city of Jingzhou.
Made a living selling pastries.
Every day he offered ten pastries to Tianhuang.
Every time after eating, Tianhuang would always leave one pastry, saying,
I give this to you to shade your children and grandchildren.
One day Longtan thought to himself,
The pastries are what I brought.
Why do you return it to me?
Does it have a different meaning?
So he went to ask about it.
The emperor said,
It is what you brought, so what is wrong with returning it to you?
Xinxuan heard this,
and he somewhat understood the profound meaning.
He then offered to leave home and become a monk.
The emperor said,
In the past you cultivated meritorious goodness.
Now you have faith in my words.
You can be named Chongxin.
From then on, he served and attended to the emperor's left and right.
Based on this, we know that
what Longtan Xinxuan inherited
is Emperor Tianhuang's enlightenment, not Emperor Tianwang's enlightenment.
This is the second piece of evidence.
Furthermore, one day Xinxuan asked Emperor Tianhuang,
Since I arrived here, I have not received any instruction on the essential mind.
The emperor said,
Since you arrived,
I have never failed to instruct you on the essential mind.
Xinxuan said,
Where did you instruct me?
The emperor said,
When you bring tea,
I receive it for you.
When you serve food,
I accept it for you.
When you bow,
I will lower my head for you.
Where is it that I have not pointed out the essentials of the mind to you?
The master lowered his head for a long time.
The emperor said,
If you see it, then see it directly.
If you contemplate it, you will miss it.
The master was enlightened on the spot.
He further asked,
How should I uphold it?
The emperor said,ğŸ”½Let your nature roam freely.
Follow conditions and be relaxed.
Just exhaust your ordinary mind.
There is no separate enlightened understanding.
One day he asked again,
What is the matter that has been transmitted from the past?
The emperor said,
It is not that I will clarify where you came from.
Xuefeng said,
How many people possess this eye?
The emperor said,
Shallow grass is easier to grow than long-lasting reeds.
Based on this, it is known that
what Yanguan is the heir of is
Emperor Wu of the Tang, not Emperor Yang of the Sui.
This is the third piece of evidence.
The three pieces of evidence that have been proven are as clear as this.
However, in the stele inscription by Qiu Xuansu,
Because Longtan succeeded to Tianwang.
How can it be unique?
Investigating this,
It is clear that it is a later person.
Falsely taking Chongxin,
Altering it into the stele inscription of Tianwang's stupa.
It is just a point of contention.
Otherwise, he will definitely erase the texts proven in the first three sections.
And only then can he make his case.
Moreover, Zhang Wujin once said:
Yunmen's sword-like wit is like Linji's.
He should be a descendant of Mazu.
This is the talk of a wild man from the east of Qi.
In the past, those who received the same teacher
Often had different sword-like wits.
How can it be that they must all be the same?
Like Yunmen and Fayan,
They both came from Xuefeng.
If Yunmen
Should return to Mazu,
Then should Fayan return to Shitou?
Like Danxia and Touzi's sword-like wit,
They are not inferior to Linji.
Xingshan and Sansheng,
Both lost their wit to Shi Shi.
Then would Danxia, Touzi, and Shiku
have to be changed to disciples of Mazu?
And as for Nanyuan and his son,
they are all disciples of Mazu.
Yet they did not use the shout or the stick.
And as for Nanyue and his son,
they are all disciples of Baizhang.
Yet they did not engage in solitary steepness.
Would they have to be changed to disciples of Shitou?
Moreover, I have examined the complete records of Xuefeng.
His Chan is replete with various styles.
The waves are vast and expansive.
Therefore, his words
sometimes resemble Linji,
sometimes resemble Caodong.
His disciples such as Xuansha, Changqing, Baofu, Gushan, An Guoqing, Jingjing, and others are all like this.
Even though Yunmen's methods are uniquely steep,
his actual words are not completely perfect.
His methods do not provoke offense.
Moreover, he visited and studied with Caoshan, Shushan, Jiufeng, and Ganfeng.
His words are complete.
Such as the words on the three kinds of illnesses, the two kinds of light, and so forth.
He completely inherited Ganfeng.
This is especially evident.
How can it be said that he is the same as Linji and should be the successor of Mazu?
Ignorant people
are indeed difficult to argue with.
The highly enlightened ones
can investigate and know.
Therefore, I write this to inform the wise people of the world.
Please examine it carefully. Seen in Yongjue's Late Records.

then one dharma and five schools cannot escape being mentioned.

Otherwise, when people die, the phrases die.

Beyond the mountain, there is Zhaohui Rock.

not yielding to the ancients,
isn't this using the eyes to guide humans and gods?
Therefore, I write this postscript.
At that time, in the year of Wuyin in the Baozhou era,
on the fifth day after the summer retreat,
the mountain dweller of Ciyun,

up to the records of the patriarchs of the five houses, he extensively researched and collated them, comparing and correcting them.

not inferior to that of Yu?
